item.title: Improving CSS Animation Performance
item.description: In my previous blog I wrote about refactoring a react application’s css and animation with Styled-Components. One specific I didn’t cover there were the improvements I made towards the application’s animation performance. If you noticed in the refactored code, I’m animating different css properties. The reason being that, in my original code my animations were causing expensive browser reflows. These browser reflows didn’t cause any visible lag while testing locally,and testing the components in isolation via dev-tools showed I was getting a consistent 60fps.

item.title: Refactoring React with Styled-Components
item.description: Refactoring with styled-components I’ve recently been working on refactoring a React web app I wrote a while back where the styling was an unpleasent mix of inline-styles,scss,and classNames scattered through different components and files. After researching different css-in-js libraries I decided to refactor with styled-components. One noticable change was the semantic improvement on my code with styled-components.
